I move for a total revamp of the Polar Bear

I tried to make a separate post about this but I guess it was to closely related to this one so I will add it here I think rideable Polar bears is a great Idea but I think they need a lot more.

 

 

The Polar Bear is a a great looking mob. And I cant help but have a moment of excitement when run into one. That is until I remember how fairly useless it is and like I said it makes me quite sad. So here is my attempt to do something about it.

 

Mount

 

Make the the bear a a mountable mob! Yea that's right what could be a cooler use for this mob than a new mount. If I am not mistaken Mincraft has not gotten a new mount since horses. The bear should be slightly faster than a pig but slower and fewer HP than a horse. It can't jump more than 1 block but can step over 2 blocks.The unique ability of this mount is that it has a powerful melee attack and a huge game changer for up close melee combat.

 

Weapons while mounted -

As the polar bear has such a lumbering gate it would likely be impossible to effectively fire a bow or swing a sword while mounted on a bear and in motion.

 

Domesticating-

Taming a polar bear should not be easy they are not know for having the best temperament. This could be accomplished not by changing the polar bear to a hostile mob outright but when you are holding a raw salmon in your hand and you are within x amount of blocks of the mob it becomes hostel. (and peaceful again when you are not holding raw salmon that is unless you already hit it.) this would keep balance to the game for players that are not looking to tame these mobs. Getting clawed by one of these giants should be quite devastating toy your health bar. So the fact that you would need to expend a large amount of salmon to convince this beast that you are trust worthy would be quite difficult. Befriending such an animal would be quite an accomplishment and a distinct advantage in combat.

 

Mounting-

As if domesticating a polar bear wasn't difficult enough. You cant just hop on a polar bear and head off to inflict damage Mounting a bear requires equipping it with a bear saddle.

 

Bear Saddle-

The Bear Saddle is a craft able item that a player will need to make. This Item should be crafted by adding on to a horse saddle with another materials like additional leather and Iron. This would require that the player do some exploring and presumably engaging in combat before obtaining the polar bear mount.

 

A possible Bear Saddle recipe

0 S 0
L 0 L

L I L

 

Drops-

Personally I am of the opinion that all mobs should drop useful items. So lets address some possible useful items that a polar bear could drop

 

Bear Hide -

a.) Bear hide can be tanned just like cow hide and made into leather IRL. So why not in Mincraft too throw it in a furnace get a few leather.

b.) Use the Fletcher station block to turn a bear hide into a bed roll. Bed Rolls can be used to sleep and skip the night without changing you spawn away from your bed. This is especially useful now that phantoms are something that we need to contend with now.

 

Bear Meat- It doesn't make any sense that an animal this size wouldn't be able to provide a substantial amount of food for a person. Raw and cooked bear meat should provide less than a raw or cooked steak respectively as it is not the most tasty and satisfying meat. But a bear s hould drop 3-5 pieces at least as the Polar Bear Is a large animal.

 

Bear Meat Stew-Raw Bear Meat, a Bowl, a Bottle of Water and, a Carrot in a crafting bench would make Bear Meat stew leaving an empty glass bottle in the bench this would provide the same hunger replenishment as a cooked steak and a carrot with improved saturation and provide the strength buff for a short time.

 

Bear's Head- Its a helmet same stats as iron but can be enchanted with a new enchantments that can only be put on this item.

a.) Predator's Instinct- When in use causes double XP to drop from mobs and players that you kill.

b.) Fight or Flight- When in use XP converts into health. If you drop to 3 or less hearts you get a speed bonus

 

Bear Claw Boots- Just like leather boots in stats but allows you so climb flat wooden black faces useful for harvesting trees or climbing wooden structures, climb a fort wall, or take a tactical sniper position on a roof. Can be used to climb non wooden surfaces but the boots take heavy damage when you do.

 

Bear Armor- It's found in igloos obviously. It could be in the furnace. its hard to find but is extremely valuable because bears have lower HP and are slow. Your bear mount is is going to need armor if you intend to ride into any serious combat. Bear armor can be enchanted with most of the standard armor enchantments.

I agree that we should be able to ride polar bears, but I don't think they should be able to be tamed. I think the polar bears should be closer related to how pigs work. You would need a saddle to ride them, and they should be controlled with a fish on a stick. Maybe they could have a unique feature like attacking instead of jumping, and this would make up for having to hold the fish on a stick and not being able to use a weapon. They should still attack you if you attack them, or if there is a baby polar bear around, and they would kick you off if you tried to ride them while they are aggravated similar to how a horse kicks you off if you don't successfully tame it. This would make it so polar bears have a unique use that is not too overpowered, and it stays true to how the game currently is, and still warns people to stay away from angry polar bears in the real world.

Heikki, I think thats the point. Animal farming is way too easy for how beneficial it becomes. Having two genders can also make males be more hostile in the wild. Imagine being attacked by rooster or bull.

Here are some possible variation suggestions:

Cows: Male cows have horns and you cannot milk them because...I mean, come on

Chickens: Roosters are hostile if attacked and if put in with other chickens, there is a higher percentage rate of hatching chicks and if put with other roosters, will cock fight until one is dead.

And animals should be able to eat your crops.
Plus they always spawn in groups or in a pair male and female.

I also want every animal to have different behaviors like pandas

EDIT: Also no male/female specifics because Mojang was very clear about that. Maybe some cows can have horns, but they would never officially be bulls, just different cows

Yes, I always wanted this, and it is just weird that chicken eggs are itens, and you find them hovering over the floor. I also made a post suggesting that they should be edible.

Yes. When chickens are bred they can produce 2 eggs (which would be placed as a block and stacked like turtle eggs).

A single chicken can still lay an egg, and it will become a baby chicken in 20 minutes, while bred chicken eggs only take 5 minutes.

Chicken eggs should be under threat just like turtle eggs.

Also, the player can right click a chicken egg block to take an egg, as well as place eggs down (which will take 40 minutes to hatch), and throw eggs (with a 10% chance of getting a chicken).

Yes, breeding chickens should work just like breeding turtles.

Chickens could lay block eggs naturally, but these would be unfertilized eggs, so they wouldn't hatch (except for the 10% chance on throwing).
Only the eggs resulting from breeding could hatch.

This new mini boss would be a Ash grey and dark blue Phoenix around half the size of the wither. It would spawn in the basalt deltas at a chance of 1/100 or 1/50 and cannot naturally spawn within 10 chunks of another. It would have two attacks a physical attack with talons that do 6/8/10 damage on easy/normal/hard and a flame burst attack that launches fire particles in all directions 20 blocks out and sets any mobs on fire for 20 ticks can be blocked with shield or completely negated with fire resistance. It would have 200 health, take no knockback and has a passive regen 1. Its main drop would be phoenix feathers (3 to 7) that make potions of Rising Phoenix that give regen and absorption. There would also be the rare drop of Phoenix ashes and a even rarer chance at blue ashes(1/50 to 1/125 blue 1/100 to 1/250) that when used in a particular process would let you gain your own Pet Phoenix that is red yellow and orange in color, Blue ash Phoenixes would be a dark, light and ocean blue mix of colors (if a pet Phoenix dies it has a 100% chance of dropping the ashes again) . When grown will fly, it will not take fire damage and it is a non-combat pet. Instead there are two things it could do the first is that for every Phoenix you have you gain regen increasing by 1 level to 3, the second method starts at 1st then the 2nd expands the area it effects and the 3rd gives regen 2. Other players Phoenixes would also add to this but not exceed the maximum of what 3 total would do.

Like the ohoenix bow, but it should shoot fiery arrows without needing the flame enchantment... all things considered, this is a very interesting idea!

Phoenix
It appears very rarely in the jungle, and more often in Nether forests, but still rarely. A player can tame a phoenix by giving it raw rabbit. Once you've tamed the phoenix, it will attack mobs that you're attacking. When it is killed, it turns into ash. From the ash, it will be reborn exactly as it was before it was killed. However, after being reborn, it must wait 10 seconds before it can attack again. The phoenix can be healed with fish.

You can make a pillar for the phoenix, which you receive after taming it. The phoenix will only sit on its pillar if you click on it and if it is within range of the pillar. To assign a pillar to a phoenix, you must place the pillar within the phoenix's range and then click on the phoenix. You can move the pillar, but if you destroy it, the phoenix wonâ€™t have anywhere to sit. If you place the pillar again, it will be empty and you can assign the phoenix to it again.

The phoenix has 20 health points and 6 attack points. You can only have one tamed phoenix. Phoenix is of dark red color

I think flamingos should be part of the swamp update.

Features:

Flamingos would live in large groups.

They will sometimes molt, and drop hot pink, light pink, and gray feathers.

They eat shrimp that turns them pink, and if they do not get enough shrimp then they will slowly change from a hot pink to a gray color.

When the shrimp population runs out, they will fly to the next shrimp infested location( the shrimp will repopulate in the first location, and will never despawn).

Flamingos will make nests and lay eggs(which are like turtle eggs and can only be obtained by the silk touch enchantment.

If you are holding shrimp then flamingos will follow you, but you can not tame them.
They can also spawn in Mangroves and bring some more color to them. I'm not sure if any fish spawn there yet though.

Here's how I would implement flamingos: ðŸ¦©
They would spawn naturally in jungles and swamps (But not the Mangrove Swamp, just the regular swamp to make the regular swamp more unique) and would eat similar to how sheep eat grass and turn it into dirt, but instead, the flamingos would dip their heads down and "eat" from the water as they are filter-feeders. They may also seek out frogspawn and try to eat that as well. They can also be tamed with frogspawn. Flamingos when they are first born will be white, but as they eat they will become more and more pink. Flamingos should also have the ability to fly as they do in real life, and if needed maybe shears could be used to clip flamingo feathers which temporarily makes them unable to fly. These flamingo feathers will not drop if the mob is killed. These special feathers can only be acquired if the flamingo is fully pink. If it is only partially pink, the feathers will be white and normal. Pink feathers however, can be used to craft anything a normal feather can craft, like brushes and arrows, but these flamingo arrows will have a longer range, and flamingo brushes will have stronger durability.

The feather idea could totally be scrapped, I just really love the idea of a bright pink mob adding a splash of color to an otherwise very dull biome like the swamp.

Bats should stay fairly passive and uninvolved, IMO, because they're supposed to be more "scenery creatures" than anything.

However, my idea: Instead of taming bats, bats should offer a strictly passive benefit. My idea is that bats nearby enchanting tables actually make the enchanting tables give more information on the enchants offered, reducing uncertainty. This would encourage "spooky bat-filled library" builds!

Another idea could be that bats react differently to certain mobs, allowing for complex detection systems, or tend to travel in the direction of mobspawners and other underground structures, sort of like dolphins.

I am in favor of this great idea, our pets should have a certain autonomy.

@Nerfix99 Autonomy is definitely an aspect that is greatly appreciated in the community, despite their unawareness of it.
Not only pets, but many current mobs could benefit from it.

I agree with this. I feel like an ai pathway should be there, and it should be smart too. Although teleporting is useful when you're flying. So, maybe instead of taking it away, the distance on how far you are from the dog is increased before teleportation.

I am also in favor of this idea. I'm tired of my pets de-spawning due to the chunk unloading because I am flying too fast (elytra and fireworks). I end up having to go back to figure out what chunk my pet was in before it was unloaded. Due to this, I end up always having to leave my pet at home because I just don't want to deal with it. 

Pets should also have a better AI to avoid hazards such as lava, falling from large heights, and not drowning themselves.

Why?  In this game, the eating is not related to living for these mobs, and it would be very annoying if it was.

Also, it's not true that sheep are the only mobs that eat.  Horses also have a grazing animation, although they do not break the grass.  Rabbits will also actually eat any mature carrot crops they come across, according to the Wiki.
